dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Uh-huh. You blind, fella? Or can you not see I'm busy?

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: No, maybe I'm the one who's blind. On second glance, you got a certain air about you - one that promises blood and bits. So which is it to be?

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well? I'm half-listening.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Need a hand for hire?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's enough for now.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: If it's one that don't mind getting dirty, then I sure do.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: There's a boarst factory on up the way, run by a man who calls himself the King. Clive Lumbergh - insufferable prick.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: That aside, it's a business ripe for the plucking. I want it. Clear as that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I get the feeling this is going to involve murder and mayhem.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Stars, I hope so.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Clive Lumbergh - the self-proclaimed Boarst King of Monarch - is swimming in profit. And drowning in his ego.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: He's making the only meal to be had this side of Monarch, and I'm tired of ponying up for my dinner. I want that boarst factory - owner dead or alive.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: And you're the soon-to-be-handsomely-paid son of a bitch who's going to get it for me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What specifically do you want me to do?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Easy as eating a cystypig pie.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Any tips on how I might get in?

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Kill him, run him out. I don't rightly care for the details. So long as Clive knows resistance to me is costly - and futile.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hit him where it hurts. In his gut or his production lines ought to make do.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Say I wanted to sabotage the factory...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Say I just kill Clive...

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Then I'd say you might care to poison the cystypigs, doctor a few financial records, or throw a wrench in the canning machinery.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sounds good.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And if I wanted to kill him?

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: It'll be more than good when you're finished. Maybe not for Clive, but for me and you, I'm sure.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh, and if you'd don't fancy going in guns blazing or crawling through a sewer pipe, see Duncan in the Dry Goods & Sundry building. He ought to have an employee ID in that stash of illicit goods he keeps for select clientèle.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: May luck be with you. Since I won't be.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sometimes the simplest solution is the sweetest. I don't give a whit about the method or the means. Just the end.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What if I decided to sabotage the factory instead?

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Guess you've got it figured out then. Good.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: If you got brass knockers, you could shoot your way through the front gate. If you don't fancy getting shot to shit, you can try asking Duncan for a disguise.

dialog.speaker: CatherineMalin (Female)
dialog.utterance: Might be another way in assuming you're courageous enough to trek the sewers. Void if I know.
